item.title: Today’s Strands #720 Hints and Answers for February 21, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Strands is a daily word search puzzle game from The New York Times. It is a relatively new game, launched in 2024, in which players seek a common theme among words in a 6×8 letter grid.

Whether it’s your first time playing or you’re a Strands veteran, today’s tips and strategies can help you find words faster. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Strands, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answers for Strands Game #720 for Saturday, February 21, 2026

To play today’s Strands, head to the game’s website.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s edition of Strands. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Strands

Strands is a daily word search that challenges you to find words with a common theme. There’s also a Spanagram that reveals the deeper theme behind the words.

  • Words that are three letters and under do not count.
  • Words that reveal the correct theme appear in blue.
  • The Spanagram turns yellow when found.
  • Finding three words that don’t fit the theme will reveal a hint to help you find the proper words.

The goal is to string together as many words as possible. Every letter on the grid gets used! Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Strands can only be played on the New York Times website. You can also play on the NYT Games app.

Strands Hints For Today, February 21, 2026

The Strands’ answers for Game #720 are all about beer and the practice of making your own beer. This is the perfect puzzle for any microbrewers out there. This puzzle has nine answers, and I needed some help with some of them. So, if you need some guidance, just keep reading.

General Strands Hints For February 21

Without giving today’s Strands answers completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: One of the answers for today’s puzzle is a basic necessity of life. Most of the Earth is comprised of this, and so are you.
  • Hint 2: A famous song by The Archies is about this sweet ingredient.
  • Hint 3: The Spanagram isn’t just related to brewing, but also about developing new games for old hardware and other fan projects.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Strands #720 for February 21, 2026.

Words to Help You Find Strand Hints for February 21, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Strands answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you unlock some in-game hints. A few starter words that may help are:

  • HEAT
  • FLARE
  • MALL
  • HOPE
  • BARE

Today’s Strands Answer For Game #720 On February 21, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answers to today’s Strands below.

  • WHEAT
  • BARLEY
  • MALT
  • WATER
  • SUGAR
  • HOPS
  • YEAST
  • FLAVOR
  • SPANAGRAM: HOMEBREW

If you solved today’s Strands without our answers, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

When Is The Next Strands Game After #720?

All New York Times games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before, giving players a heads-up. The game on February 22 will be Strands Game #721.

What Is Strands?

Strands is a daily word search puzzle game created by The New York Times. Launched in 2024, Strands challenges players to discover a common theme among words in a 6×8 letter grid. The game’s original concept was developed by Juliette Seive, a research director on The New York Times Games team, with the aim of replicating Wordle’s success. Tracy Bennett serves as the puzzle editor for Strands, overseeing the creation and curation of daily puzzles since its launch.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Xbox CEO Wants to Develop Stories With Emotional Resonance
item.content:encoded:
New Microsoft Gaming CEO Asha Sharma discusses what she likes in video games. She also admits she’s got a lot to learn in her new role.

Asha Sharma became the head of Xbox on February 20, 2026, following a shake-up that saw Phil Spencer retire and Sarah Bond leave the company. She’s tried to be an engaging CEO in her first 24 hours, outlining her vision for AI in Xbox’s future and responding to gamers on social media. Still, her background at Microsoft saw her leading the CoreAI division.

Before Microsoft, she held top positions for Instacart and Meta. While those are successful companies, they don’t exactly scream “gaming.” As such, Sharma knows she has a lot to learn in her new position.

Asha Sharma on What She Likes to See in Video Games

In an interview with Variety, Sharma was quoted as saying that she likes games with deep emotional resonance. She also touted the game Firewatch as a game that resonated with her emotionally.

Sharma plans to win over core Xbox gamers and earn the right to be trusted. She hopes to develop consistency over time that will lead to a stronger relationship with the player base. “I’m coming into gaming as a platform builder,” Sharma noted.

In response to a social media comment, she even listed her three favorite games: Halo, Valheim, and GoldenEye.

Moving forward, she will work closely with Matt Booty to enact her initiatives. Sarah Bond will assist her and provide guidance during the transition before her exit from Microsoft. Learn more about Sarah’s departure from Microsoft at this link.

Learn more about Phil Spencer’s retirement and Xbox’s restructuring at this link. Check out Asha Sharma’s full memo to her team following the shakeups here.

What are your thoughts on the future of Xbox? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: WWE 2K26 MyFACTION Designer Talks Microtransactions
item.content:encoded:
WWE 2K26 will once again include MyFACTION, a single-player mode that competes with NBA 2K’s MyTeam and EA Sports FC’s Ultimate Team. It offers a collection-oriented experience centered on in-game trading cards.

Players start with a specific pack of wrestlers and then use in-game points or virtual currency to purchase new packs that improve their team.

As with most sports and live-service games in 2026, microtransactions are part of the experience. In the case of WWE games, microtransactions will allow you to get a specific card of a specific player needed for a specific event. Now, the team behind the mode is discussing their philosophy on microtransactions in MyFACTION.

WWE 2K26 Designer Says They Try To Provide Extra Benefits for Players Who Pay for MyFACTION Content

Interview with VGC, Terrell Carter, MyFACTION’s lead designer, explains that he and the team try to give players an extra benefit for spending real-world money.

Internally, the hope is that they don’t make players feel they have to make purchases like that to use any of the game’s features. Still, if the purchase is made, they want them to feel there is as much upside as possible.

“So we try to give more content based on those things, rather than be ultra restrictive. Hopefully, it doesn’t feel ultra-restrictive to the players,” he said.

Team Chemistry is A Major Feature in This Year’s MyFACTION Mode

2K recently announced that a new mechanic called team chemistry would be a major focal point of this year’s MyFACTION. With 60 in-game traits that can have positive and negative effects on your team, there are plenty of scenarios that will play out depending on your specific team’s chemistry.

For example, Carter says that if your team has bad chemistry, it could fall apart when Partners refuse to tag each other. Luckily, there’s a way to circumvent that: a new teleport option this year that draws on fighting games like Marvel vs. Capcom and places them in the WWE environment. Learn more about that here.

Are you excited for WWE 2K26? Sound off in our official Discord server. For more WWE 2K26, learn about this year’s story mode. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Toronto KOI Ends CDL Losing Streak After Roster Change
item.content:encoded:
Toronto KOI has just secured a win after an eight-match losing streak in the Call of Duty League. The team managed to produce a huge 3-0 sweep over Minnesota G2, putting out something of a masterclass while flexing the new talent in the recently promoted Kips. The young competitor came up from Challengers, departing the Huntsmen and moving into the League.

It was a much-needed victory for Toronto KOI, especially in the run-up to Major II, which will take place in the United Kingdom for the first time in six years.

Toronto KOI Manages to Secure a Win

Toronto KOI, which rebranded ahead of this season after dropping the Ultra moniker, has pulled off a sweep against Minnesota G2. The Call of Duty League has not been kind to Toronto KOI this season, and the team currently sits in 10th place in the overall season standings.

That being said, today’s fixture against G2 could be an indicator of things to come, now that Kips has taken up a spot on the roster after moving up from the Huntsmen. To make space for him, Reeal was pushed out.

Kips admitted in a post-match interview that his first series with Toronto, which was a 0-3 loss to FaZe Vegas, was him getting his feet wet. He now has a win under his belt in the Call of Duty League, and it was secured against a Minnesota side that hasn’t been performing too badly of late.

Minnesota went on something of a run at Major I in Dallas, Texas, in January. The squad pushed FaZe Vegas into the lower bracket and eliminated Miami Heretics from the tournament before falling in a very close redemption series against FaZe.

Toronto’s next fixture will be next Saturday against Miami Heretics, followed by a series against Paris Gentle Mates, this season’s Major I champion side. Will Toronto remain resilient?

Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server if you’re enjoying the Call of Duty League this season.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that FURIA has dropped its Rainbow Six roster

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

More from Grant Taylor-Hill

item.title: New Xbox CEO Responds to Fan’s Desire For Console Exclusives
item.content:encoded:
Asha Sharma hears fans’ concerns and desires for console-exclusive video games.

Asha Sharma was promoted to Microsoft Gaming CEO as part of a restructuring on Friday, February 20, 2026. Sarah Bond, former Xbox president, has resigned from the company, and Phil Spencer, longtime Xbox head, has retired from Microsoft after nearly 40 years.

With her appointment to the top of Microsoft Gaming signaling the beginning of a new era for Xbox one gamer tweeted her to ask for the return of console exclusives. Sharma responded with, “Hear you.” She also responded to someone’s list of the top 3 Xbox exclusive franchises.

Recently, Microsoft has begun porting games from its Studios to other platforms as it continues to push the idea that most pieces of tech can be an Xbox.

Asha Sharma Wants to Bring About ‘The Return of Xbox’

In a memo she issued following her appointment as Microsoft gaming CEO, Sharma emphasized that her first commitment is to ensure there are great games for Microsoft-owned studios. Her second initiative focuses on “the return of Xbox.” Specifically, she wants to spearhead a recommitment to core Xbox fans and players.

“We will celebrate our roots with a renewed commitment to Xbox starting with console which has shaped who we are. It connects us to the players and fans who invest in Xbox, and to the developers who build ambitious experiences for it,” she wrote.

Sharma is the former head of CoreAI at Microsoft. Read her comments on AI in gaming at this link. You can read her complete memo regarding her promotion by clicking here.

What do you think, could we see the return of Xbox-exclusive video games? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Midsummer Studios Shuts Down Less Than 2 Years After Launch
item.content:encoded:
Midsummer Studios has closed, but not before giving a look at a life simulator that the team was working on.

The studio was founded by XCOM designer Jake Solomon, and it was Solomon who shared on social media that the studio was closing its doors but wanted to provide a look at a game called Burbank. According to Solomon, the game was a mix of The Sims and The Truman Show, the film starring Jim Carrey that focused on a man discovering that his life was a television series.

“We built a studio, we made a game, and I’m really proud of both,” wrote Solomon. “This game was a dream of mine, our team made it come true, so watch and dream with us,” he said in his post.

Jake Solomon later stated in a social media post that the characters in the pre-alpha trailer he shared were generated by AI. However, he insists that the studio had no intention of replacing any developers with AI.

“Our characters use AI for memory, reasoning and speech. That’s what let’s you create anyone you want and drop them in any story you write. But all of our art is created by our talented artists. We had no interest in replacing any developers with AI,” he wrote.

History of Midsummer Studios

The studio opened in 2024, with Solomon partnering with Will Miller, the lead designer at Firaxis Games, and Leslie Birch. Less than 2 years later, it is closed. The studio launched with $6 million in funding from investors.

The initial press release announcing the company states that Transcend Fund led the way, with participation from Tirta Ventures, Betaworks Ventures, 1 Up Ventures, F4 Fund, Krafton, and Day Zero Productions.

The major life simulator was the company’s main game.

There are even more major shakeups in the game industry. Recently, Ubisoft Toronto confirmed that it had laid off 40 employees.

Xbox is also undergoing a massive restructuring, following Phil Spencer’s recent retirement and Sarah Bond’s resignation from the company. Learn more about that restructuring here.

What do you think about the footage from Burbank? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1709: Hints and Answer for February 22, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1709 for February 22, 2026

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, February 22, 2026

The Wordle answer for game #1709 will give you a challenge. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 4.6 out of 6 guesses. That makes it just slightly easier than the 5-guess average from February 21.

General Wordle Hints For February 22

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word refers to a specific type of item, not a category or action.
  • Hint 2: It’s most often encountered in food-related contexts.
  • Hint 3: The word is more common in menus or descriptions than everyday conversation.
  • Hint 4: You’re more likely to see it used when something is being identified or highlighted, not casually mentioned.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1709 for February 22, 2026.

Starter Words For February 22, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • GUARD
  • FRUIT
  • VAULT
  • AGAVE
  • NAVAL

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1709 On February 22, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: GUAVA

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today’s Wordle Answer Mean?

GUAVA is a noun that means “any of numerous tropical and subtropical American trees or shrubs belonging to the genus Psidium, of the myrtle family, especially P. guajava, bearing large, yellow, round to pear-shaped fruit, and P. littorale, bearing smaller, yellowish to deep-red, oval fruit.”

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1708 on February 21, 2026

Answer: AWAKE

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1709?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on February 23 will be Wordle Game #1710.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter

item.title: Slay the Spire 2 Early Access Release Date Set
item.content:encoded:
The day that Slay the Spire 2 will enter Early Access has been confirmed. Thankfully, for fans of the beloved roguelike deckbuilder, they won’t have to wait long.

Slay the Spire 2 enters Steam Early Access on Thursday, March 5, 2026, 12 days from this writing. Mega Crit announced the news in a YouTube trailer.

This is the long-awaited follow-up to the game that helped solidify the roguelike deckbuilder genre. Shore, some may feel like they’re a dime a dozen these days, but Slay the Spire 2 gets the opportunity to finally build on what the original game brought to the table in 2019.

Slay the Spire 2 Was Originally Set for a 2025 Release

The sequel to 2019’s Slay the Spire was originally scheduled for an Early Access release in late 2025. However, in September, Mega Crit announced it would delay the game to uphold its own quality standards.

Such improvements will include a new 4-player co-op mode, complete with specific multiplayer cards and new team synergies. Learn more about the new developments and updates here.

Insider Gaming will provide more information on the upcoming Slay the Spire sequel as Early Access approaches.

Are you excited for this next entry in the roguelike deckbuilding genre? With the release of games like Resident Evil Requiem, Slay the Spire 2, and WWE 2K26 all coming within the next couple of weeks, what games are you prioritizing? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
